translated: The Sutra of King Ajatashatru of Magadha in the womb says: King Udayana, King Munda, King Ajatashatru, the chief of the most soldiers, the chief of the handsome soldiers, the chief of the prosperous soldiers, the chief of the vajra soldiers, each with four divisions of troops. The king sent the brahmin of the fragrant surname. The Ten Recitations Vinaya says: Because of the surname, the Sutra of the Womb says: Upāli said to the Koshala strongmen:
The Buddha is my teacher, I respect him.
He attained nirvana in your country.

original: 故從遠來請舍利分還國起塔。
analyzed: 故從遠來請舍利分還國起塔。
translated: Therefore, I came from afar to request a share of the relics to return to my country and build a stupa.

original: 若分與我者舉國寶重與君共之。
analyzed: 若分與我者舉國寶重與君共之。
translated: If you give me a share, the treasures of the whole country will be shared with you.
The strongmen replied:

original: 世尊屈降此土於茲滅度。
analyzed: 世尊屈降此土於茲滅度。
translated: The World-Honored One condescended to this land and attained nirvana here.
The people of the country should make offerings themselves.
It is not possible to trouble you from afar.
The kings discussed together.
Their humble words and peaceful requests were not accepted.
They would not spare their lives and would take it by force.
The king of the strongmen said:
If you want to raise troops, you will not be able to match each other's strength.
In the end, it will not be possible.

original: 香姓婆羅門於八眾中高聲唱言。
analyzed: 香姓婆羅門於八眾中高聲唱言。
translated: The Brahmin of the Gandhara clan shouted loudly among the eight groups, saying:
The Buddha has accumulated good patience for immeasurable eons.
You all should also hear and praise patience.
How can you raise troops to compete and oppress each other?
This is not a respectful matter.

original: 今舍利現在但當分作八分。
analyzed: 今舍利現在但當分作八分。
translated: Now the relics are present, you should divide them into eight parts.
Allow the people everywhere to make offerings.

original: 諸君亦皆受佛戒口誦語言。
analyzed: 諸君亦皆受佛戒口誦語言。
translated: You all have also received the Buddha's precepts and recite the words with your mouths.
You can fight over the relics and end up harming each other.
The strong men replied:
We respect your opinion.
At that time, the Brahmin of the Gandhara clan
divided them into eight parts.

original: 時釋提桓因即現為人語諸王言。
analyzed: 時釋提桓因即現為人語諸王言。
translated: Then Shakra Devanagaya appeared as a man and said to the kings:
We gods should also have a share.
If we compete with force, there will be victory and defeat.
Please give us a share, it will not be difficult.

original: 時阿耨達龍王文隣龍王伊那鉢龍王語八王言。
analyzed: 時阿耨達龍王文隣龍王伊那鉢龍王語八王言。
translated: At that time, the dragon kings Anavatapta, Manlin, and Inabatu said to the eight kings:
We should also have a share of the relics.
If you do not give us a share, we have enough strength to defeat you.
Then Upali said:
You should stop, we should divide it together.

original: 即分為三分。🔽一分與諸天。
analyzed: 即分為三分。 一分與諸天。
translated: He then divided it into three parts.🔽One part was given to the gods,
one part was given to the dragon kings,
and one part belonged to the eight kings.
Honey was smeared inside the urn and the urn was used to measure it.

original: 諸天得分還於天上起七寶塔。
analyzed: 諸天得分還於天上起七寶塔。
translated: The gods, having obtained their share, returned to the heavens and built a seven-jeweled stupa.

original: 諸龍得分還於龍宮亦起寶塔。
analyzed: 諸龍得分還於龍宮亦起寶塔。
translated: The dragons, having obtained their share, also returned to the dragon palace and built a jeweled stupa.

original: 阿闍貰王共數其分各得八萬四千舍利。
analyzed: 阿闍貰王共數其分各得八萬四千舍利。
translated: King Ajatashatru counted his share and obtained 84,000 relics.
There was one more relic in the Buddha's mouth that no one dared to take.

original: 以阿闍貰王初求舍利投地氣乏最為篤至共持與之。
analyzed: 以阿闍貰王初求舍利投地氣乏最為篤至共持與之。
translated: Because King Ajatashatru was the first to request the relics, he fell to the ground out of exhaustion, but his sincerity was the greatest, so they gave it to him together.
King Ajatashatru was delighted and the music moved the heavens.

original: 難頭示龍王中道相逢曰。
analyzed: 難頭示龍王中道相逢曰。
translated: Nan-t'ou Shih-lung Wang met him on the road and said:
The Buddha left a share of his relics and gave one part to me.
The king said:
It cannot be obtained.
The dragon said:
I am Nan-t'ou Shih.

original: 能舉卿國土擲八萬里外磨碎如塵。
analyzed: 能舉卿國土擲八萬里外磨碎如塵。
translated: I can lift your country and throw it eighty thousand miles away, grinding it to dust.
The king was immediately frightened and gave the Buddha's relics to him.
The dragon built a stupa under Mount Sumeru,
eighty-four thousand li high.
He erected a crystal and lapis lazuli stupa.
King Ajatashatru passed away.
Ayu obtained his country.
At that time, a great minister said to King Ayu:

original: 難頭示龍先易阿闍貰奪將佛𣯃去。
analyzed: 難頭示龍先易阿闍貰奪將佛𣯃去。

When Ayu heard this,

translated: he ordered the king of ghosts to make an iron net and iron fence,

original: 水精塔下自出相見具說本末其瞋必息。
analyzed: 水精塔下自出相見具說本末其瞋必息。
translated: Under the crystal stupa, they came out on their own and met each other. They fully explained the past and present. His anger must have subsided.
He then sent the dragon to hold and take Aśoka's palace.
When he woke up from sleep, he did not know where it was.

original: 見水精塔高八萬四千里。
analyzed: 見水精塔高八萬四千里。
translated: He saw the crystal stupa, eighty-four thousand li high.
Joy and fear mixed.
Nan-t'ou showed the dragon coming out and apologized, saying:

original: 阿闍貰王自持與我我不奪也。
analyzed: 阿闍貰王自持與我我不奪也。
translated: King Aśoka himself gave it to me. I did not take it by force.
The Śākyamuni Tathāgata made an agreement with me in the past, saying:

original: 吾涅槃後劫將盡時所有經律及袈裟應器皆取藏此塔中。
analyzed: 吾涅槃後劫將盡時所有經律及袈裟應器皆取藏此塔中。
translated: After my nirvāṇa, when the kalpa is about to end, all the sūtras, vinaya texts, and kaṣāya robes should be taken and stored in this stupa.
When Maitreya comes down, he will take them out again.
The dragon sent the king's palace back to its original place.
The brāhman of Yen said:

original: 請舍利瓶菩薩胎經云瓫我還頭那羅聚落起於瓶塔。
analyzed: 請舍利瓶菩薩胎經云瓫我還頭那羅聚落起於瓶塔。
translated: Please give me the śarīra jar. The Bodhisattva's Womb Sūtra says it is a basin. I will return to the village of T'ou-na-lo and build a jar stūpa.
The strong men gave it to him.

original: 以瓶及著瓶舍利共起寶塔。
analyzed: 以瓶及著瓶舍利共起寶塔。
translated: They built a jeweled stupa together with the urn and the relics in the urn.

original: 波羅延那婆羅門居士復言。
analyzed: 波羅延那婆羅門居士復言。
translated: The brāhmaṇas and householders of Poluoni said:
Give us the ashes from burning the Buddha.
We will return to our country and build a stupa for the ashes.

original: 衡國異道士求取地灰還國起塔。
analyzed: 衡國異道士求取地灰還國起塔。
translated: The non-Buddhist practitioners from the country of Heng requested to take the ashes of the ground back to their country to build a stupa.
The strong men agreed.

analyzed: 亦有於闍維處起立寶塔。
translated: They also built a jeweled stupa at the place of cremation.
There were forty-nine hu of ashes,
and they built forty-nine jeweled stupas.

analyzed: 此塔我所供養願為留之。
translated: This stupa I have made offerings to. Please leave it for me.
The king immediately agreed.

analyzed: 還國造作八萬四千寶函分布舍利遍此函中。

analyzed: 復作八萬四千寶瓶及諸幡蓋。
translated: He also made 84,000 jeweled bottles and various banners and canopies.

original: 付諸夜叉於閻浮提一切地乃至大海處處起塔。
analyzed: 付諸夜叉於閻浮提一切地乃至大海處處起塔。
translated: He entrusted the yakshas to erect stupas everywhere in Jambudvipa, up to the great ocean.
First, he consulted with the arhat Yasas, saying:

original: 欲於一日一念中起八萬四千塔令一時俱成。
analyzed: 欲於一日一念中起八萬四千塔令一時俱成。
translated: I wish to erect 84,000 stupas in one day and one thought, and have them all completed at the same time.
The arhat Yasas greatly praised him.
Later, the king competed with the dragon in their merits.
They weighed the two images.
The dragon was heavy and the king was light.
The king widely invited the monks and tirelessly planted merits.
Later, they weighed again.
The weight was balanced.
The king further cultivated.
He knew that his merits increased day by day.
He raised troops to attack.
He had just set out on the road.
The dragon king, big and small, all came out to welcome him.
He offered a stupa relic to the king.

original: 後觀佛得道化人之處隨復造塔出阿育王經第一卷又出雜譬喻經上卷在王境內有一千二百寺。
analyzed: 後觀佛得道化人之處隨復造塔出阿育王經第一卷又出雜譬喻經上卷在王境內有一千二百寺。
translated: Later, he built stupas at the places where the Buddha attained enlightenment and transformed people. He built a thousand and two hundred temples within the king's territory.

original: 造織金縷幡亦一千二百。
analyzed: 造織金縷幡亦一千二百。
translated: He also made a thousand and two hundred banners woven with gold thread.

original: 又千葉金華欲手自懸散。
analyzed: 又千葉金華欲手自懸散。
translated: He also had a thousand-petaled golden flower that he wanted to personally scatter.
Just as he was about to finish, he encountered a serious illness.
Fearing it would go against his original intention, he wept.
The śramaṇa said to the king,
The merit you have cultivated is immeasurable.
Why do you grieve when you should be opening your mind?
Just be single-minded.
I will make you attain the fruits of your wishes.

original: 沙門即以神力使一千二百寺皆現王前。
analyzed: 沙門即以神力使一千二百寺皆現王前。
translated: The śramaṇa then used his spiritual powers to make the thousand and two hundred temples all appear before the king.
His illness was immediately cured.
He wanted to hang the banners.
All the flagpoles bent down to the king's hand.
He accomplished his original vow.

original: 延壽二十五年出迦葉經又出雜譬喻經又興功德二十年中。
analyzed: 延壽二十五年出迦葉經又出雜譬喻經又興功德二十年中。
translated: He extended his life by twenty-five years. It is said in the Kāśyapa Sutra and the Collection of Various Parables that he also cultivated merit for twenty years.
At the time of death,
continuously recollecting the Three Jewels, mind after mind without interruption.

original: 無所悋惜盡成菩提出雜阿含經第二十五卷。
analyzed: 無所悋惜盡成菩提出雜阿含經第二十五卷。

analyzed: 分身舍利起八萬四千寶塔。

analyzed: 過去有國王名波塞奇領閻浮提八萬四千國。

At that time there was a buddha named Vipaśyin.

original: 王與臣民供養於佛及比丘僧。
analyzed: 王與臣民供養於佛及比丘僧。
translated: The king, together with his ministers and people, made offerings to the Buddha and the community of bhikṣus.
At that time the king thought:

original: 邊陲小國處所偏僻人民之類無由修福。
analyzed: 邊陲小國處所偏僻人民之類無由修福。
translated: The people in the remote small countries in the borderlands have no opportunity to cultivate merit.
He then summoned a painter to draw a Buddha image.
Distributing it to the distant countries, all could make offerings.
At that time the painters looked at the Buddha's excellent marks.

original: 適得一處忘失餘處不能得成。
analyzed: 適得一處忘失餘處不能得成。
translated: They only managed to get one place, forgetting the rest, and could not complete it.
At that time, King Prasenajit

original: 調和眾彩手自畫像以為模楷。
analyzed: 調和眾彩手自畫像以為模楷。
translated: harmonized various colors and painted the image with his own hands as a model.

original: 諸師寫學畫八萬四千像。
analyzed: 諸師寫學畫八萬四千像。
translated: The masters copied and painted 84,000 images.
They were distributed to 84,000 small countries.
The kings of the small countries all made offerings.
I am King Prasenajit now.

original: 緣此功德身有三十二相。
analyzed: 緣此功德身有三十二相。
translated: Because of this merit, my body has thirty-two marks.

original: 涅槃之後復得八萬四千諸塔出賢愚經第四卷。
analyzed: 涅槃之後復得八萬四千諸塔出賢愚經第四卷。
translated: After nirvana, I will also have 84,000 stupas. From the Sutra of Wise and Foolish, Scroll 4.

original: 4 弗沙蜜多羅王壞八萬四千塔弗沙蜜多羅王壞八萬四千塔四阿育王崩。
analyzed: 4 弗沙蜜多羅王壞八萬四千塔弗沙蜜多羅王壞八萬四千塔四阿育王崩。
translated: King Prasenajit destroyed 84,000 stupas. King Prasenajit destroyed 84,000 stupas. After King Asoka passed away,

original: 諸臣欲立太子以紹王位。
analyzed: 諸臣欲立太子以紹王位。
translated: his ministers wanted to establish the prince to succeed to the throne.
There was a great minister,
named Atula.
He said,
King Asoka
vowed to give away 100 billion gold coins,
to make various merits.
There are still 4 billion short.
The prince sealed the treasury and did not give it.
The king gave away the land of Jambudvipa.
To give to the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha.
I wish to fulfill it.
Today the entire earth belongs to the Three Jewels.
How can you let the prince become king?

original: 諸臣即辦四億金送寺然後共立。
analyzed: 諸臣即辦四億金送寺然後共立。
translated: The ministers then prepared four hundred million gold coins and sent them to the temple before jointly establishing him.
Knowing that he was the king of the fourth generation.
Named Prasenajit.
He asked the ministers, saying:
What kind of deeds should I do?
To make my name and deeds last long?
A minister said to the king:
The previous king Aśoka
built eighty-four thousand stūpas of the Tathāgata.
And made various offerings.
The fame and virtue are passed down without interruption.
The king said:
The previous king had great authority and virtue.
He was able to accomplish this.
I cannot do it.
Think of other matters.
A minister said:
There are two kinds of dharmas.
The fame is not extinguished.
One is doing good.

analyzed: 二者作惡。 先王造塔。
translated: Two is doing evil.🔽The previous king built stūpas.
Now the king destroys the stūpas.
Both were not decayed.
The king then followed his advice.
He immediately raised four armies and went to the temples.
First, he arrived at the front gate of the Kukkutārāma Temple.
There was a stone lion.
It then roared like a lion.
The king was frightened upon hearing it.
He returned to the city.
This happened three times.
He called the monks and asked them,
Should I destroy the stupas or the dwellings? Which is better?
The monks replied,
Neither should be done.

original: 必不得已寧壞僧房勿壞塔也。
analyzed: 必不得已寧壞僧房勿壞塔也。
translated: If it is absolutely unavoidable, it is better to destroy the monks' dwellings than the stupas.
The king then killed the monks.
He destroyed the stupas and temples.
He reached the country of Pāgalā.
He also proclaimed,

original: 若有得沙門頭者賞之千金。
analyzed: 若有得沙門頭者賞之千金。
translated: I will reward a thousand gold coins to anyone who can bring me a śramaṇa's head.
In this country, there was an arhat.
He transformed into many bhikṣus' heads.
He passed them on to the people to send and request the gold.
The king's treasury ran out of gold and treasures.
Later, he realized it was the arhat and became even more angry.
The arhat entered the concentration of cessation.
The king went to kill him but could not succeed.
Because of the power of the concentration of cessation, he did not injure his body.

original: 如是漸進至塔門邊牙齒塔。
analyzed: 如是漸進至塔門邊牙齒塔。
translated: In this way, he gradually advanced to the gate of the stupa, to the stupa of the teeth.
The spirit said:
A worm-walking spirit previously sought my daughter.
I did not give her to him.
Now, for the sake of protecting the Dharma, I call my daughter and give her to him.
Together, they made a vow, saying:
You subdue this king and do not destroy the true Dharma.

original: 時蟲行神往南方海中排摚大山推迮王上及四兵眾。
analyzed: 時蟲行神往南方海中排摚大山推迮王上及四兵眾。
translated: At that time, the worm-walking spirit went to the ocean in the south, pushed and shoved a large mountain, and pushed it against the king and the four divisions of troops.
There were none who did not die.
The crowd shouted:
Excellent! Excellent!

original: 孔雀苗裔於此永盡出雜阿含經第二十五卷。
analyzed: 孔雀苗裔於此永盡出雜阿含經第二十五卷。
translated: The descendants of the peacock have completely ended here. From the Saṃyuktâgama Sūtra, Scroll 25.

original: 5 天愛帝須王起塔請舍利及菩提樹天愛帝須王起塔請舍利及菩提樹五摩哂陀等諸比丘。
analyzed: 5 天愛帝須王起塔請舍利及菩提樹天愛帝須王起塔請舍利及菩提樹五摩哂陀等諸比丘。
translated: King Aśoka builds a stūpa and requests the relics and bodhi tree. King Aśoka builds a stūpa and requests the relics and bodhi tree. The five monks including Mahinda.

original: 受師子國王名天愛帝須。
analyzed: 受師子國王名天愛帝須。
translated: Accept the name of King Aśoka of the Lion Country.
After three months of summer, the four kinds of offerings were completed.
He took leave of the king, saying:
In the past, I relied on the teacher's side.
Morning and evening, I served him.
I made offerings and paid homage.
It has been a long time since I left.
I now wish to return.
The king said:
Relying on the Dharma master,
I have received the precepts of taking refuge.
Why are you not happy with the four kinds of offerings?
The monk said:
The Buddha has already entered nirvana.
Now he says:
I want to return to ask about your well-being.
The monks said:
The Buddha has entered parinirvāṇa.
His relics still remain.
The king said:
Venerable ones,

original: 當欲令我起塔為量度好處。
analyzed: 當欲令我起塔為量度好處。
translated: I wish to have a stūpa built for the relics.
He then went to the novice monk Sumana
and asked:
How can I obtain the Tathāgata's relics?
The novice monk replied:
Just clean the road and burn incense and scatter flowers.
The king and his retinue together received the eight precepts.
They left the Nāga Grove🔽and went to the place where the relics were.
This is the usual practice.
The king immediately made preparations.

original: 修摩那還啟其祖具宣上事。
analyzed: 修摩那還啟其祖具宣上事。
translated: Sumana returned and fully explained the above matter to his grandfather.
He wanted to build a stupa.
He requested to be given the relics.

original: 阿育曰汝可往忉利天宮白帝釋。
analyzed: 阿育曰汝可往忉利天宮白帝釋。
translated: Aśoka said, You can go to the Heaven of the Thirty-three and tell Śakra.
Śakra had two relics.
One was the right tusk, which Śakra kept for worship.

original: 二者右缺瓫骨必付汝來。
analyzed: 二者右缺瓫骨必付汝來。
translated: The other was the right rib bone, which he would definitely give to you.
He opened the casket, took out the relics, and placed them in the bowl.

original: 滿鉢白光猶如真珠以授與沙彌。
analyzed: 滿鉢白光猶如真珠以授與沙彌。
translated: The bowl was filled with white light like real pearls, which he gave to the novice monk.

original: 沙彌復至帝釋宮求右缺瓫骨。
analyzed: 沙彌復至帝釋宮求右缺瓫骨。
translated: The novice monk then went to Śakra's palace to seek the right rib bone.
Śakra said,
Excellent!
He opened the casket and gave it to him.

original: 沙彌以祖所與舍利與王。
analyzed: 沙彌以祖所與舍利與王。
translated: The novice monk gave the relics his grandfather had given to the king.
The king thought,
I will hold the Tathāgata's relics on my head.
Before he finished thinking,
the elephant immediately fell to the ground.
A white parasol came down by itself.
The casket went up onto his head.
The king's whole body was delighted, as if he had obtained nectar.
A fine mist rained down and the earth shook greatly.
The king asked the Venerable One,
What should be done now?
He replied,
Place it on the elephant's head.
The elephant let out a sound in offering to the relics.
The devas, nāgas, and spirits all greatly rejoiced.
They then entered the city and the people made offerings.
Leaving from the southern gate, they circumambulated and took the stūpa.

original: 昔三佛舍利亦在此塔園中。
analyzed: 昔三佛舍利亦在此塔園中。
translated: The relics of the three Buddhas of the past were also in this stūpa garden.
They cut down the thorns and first built the foundation of the stūpa.
It was level with the elephant's head.
He said to the Venerable One,
What should the shape of the stūpa be?
Moggaliputta-tissa replied,
It should be like a rice granary.
The king said,
Excellent!
He then built a small stūpa and wanted to lower the relics.
The entire country and people all gathered.
The relics rose up into the sky from the elephant's head,
seven tāla trees high, displaying various spiritual transformations.

analyzed: 五色玄黃。 或時出水。
translated: The five colors were deep and yellow.🔽Sometimes water emerged,
sometimes fire emerged.
Still, he took the relics and placed them in a stupa.
Heaven and earth shook.
The great king's wife,
named Atula,
left the home-life following Mahinda.
Mahinda said,
I cannot ordain women.
My sister named Saṃghamittā,
is in the country of Pāṭaliputra.
The king may go to welcome her and the Bodhi tree.
The king sent his nephew named Aṭṭha,

original: 摩哂陀以神通力即令下船一日便至。
analyzed: 摩哂陀以神通力即令下船一日便至。
translated: Mahinda used his spiritual powers to make the ship land in one day.
He said to King Aśoka,

original: 摩哂陀使我來具陳上意。
analyzed: 摩哂陀使我來具陳上意。
translated: Mahinda sent me to come and fully convey his intention.
The king said,
My son Mahinda,
and my grandson Sumana,
since parting I have worried and been unhappy in my heart.
Day and night I am troubled as if my hands and feet were cut off.
Now seeing this nun I am relieved.
If she goes again I will surely die.
He told the nun not to go.
The nun said to the king,
Seeing your intention is hard to go against.
The Śākya wife saw that they were waiting for the departure of the renunciant.

original: 王許菩提樹不可刀斧分。
analyzed: 王許菩提樹不可刀斧分。
translated: The king said that the Bodhi tree could not be divided with axes.
Maudgalyāyana's son, Emperor Su, said:
When the Tathāgata was in the world, there were already five edicts.

original: 一阿育王取菩提樹與師子國不用刀斧。
analyzed: 一阿育王取菩提樹與師子國不用刀斧。
translated: First, King Aśoka took the Bodhi tree and gave it to the Lion Country, not using axes.
The southern branch broke off by itself and entered the golden basin.
Second, it rose into the sky and stayed above the clouds.

original: 三七日後自下還金瓫中。
analyzed: 三七日後自下還金瓫中。
translated: Third, after seven days, it descended back into the golden basin.

original: 布葉榮茂離離結實其葉玄黃。
analyzed: 布葉榮茂離離結實其葉玄黃。
translated: The leaves spread out luxuriantly, and it bore fruit. The leaves were dark yellow.
Fourth, in the Lion Country.
First, they wanted to obtain my relics.
They should perform various spiritual transformations.
Fifth, if they have all the major and minor marks,
When they arrive in the Lion Country, it will be as if I am in the world.
When the king heard this, he was delighted and made a vow, saying:

original: 若許取枝者令樹悉現一切面枝。
analyzed: 若許取枝者令樹悉現一切面枝。
translated: If you allow me to take a branch, make the tree show branches on all sides.

original: 若許往師子國者願自落金瓫樹復如本。
analyzed: 若許往師子國者願自落金瓫樹復如本。
translated: If you allow me to go to the Lion Country, may it fall into the golden basin by itself and the tree return to its original state.
He then filled the golden basin with fragrant mud.
On the fifteenth day of the eighth month, in the afternoon,

original: 筆畫樹枝曲處凡作十畫。
analyzed: 筆畫樹枝曲處凡作十畫。
translated: he drew ten strokes on a curved spot on a tree branch with a brush.
The first stroke produced a root,
and the last stroke cut it off.
The root grew four inches long and produced fine roots.
The branches spread out like a net.
The main branch was ten cubits long,
and there were five branches each four cubits long.
Each of the five branches produced a fruit.
There were also a thousand small branches.
When the king saw this miraculous transformation, he was overjoyed.
He shouted loudly at the tree,
and the assembly of monks chanted svaha.

original: 小王及倍從一切大眾皆悉大叫。
analyzed: 小王及倍從一切大眾皆悉大叫。
translated: The small kings and all the great assembly shouted loudly.

original: 地神驚怪亦復大叫聲徹虛空。
analyzed: 地神驚怪亦復大叫聲徹虛空。
translated: The earth spirits were startled and also shouted loudly, and the sound reached the heavens.
In this way, it spread to the Brahma Heaven.

original: 樹枝從本改處即有百根。
analyzed: 樹枝從本改處即有百根。
translated: The branches changed from the original place and there were a hundred roots.
Ten roots went straight down to the bottom of the basin and penetrated below it.
The ninety fine roots surrounded and grew.
In this way, they grew larger day and night.
At that time, the earth shook in six ways.
The devas in the sky played various kinds of music.
The mountains and trees danced like people.
The devas clapped their hands.
The yakṣas laughed joyfully.
The asura kings sang praises.
The Brahmā kings were delighted.
In the sky there were thunder and lightning.
The four-legged creatures ran and cried out.
The birds flew and made various sounds.
The bodhi tree produced six-colored light.

original: 光明遍照滿於娑婆上至梵天。
analyzed: 光明遍照滿於娑婆上至梵天。
translated: The light illuminated the Sahā world up to the Brahma Heaven.
At that time, the bodhi tree rose into the sky.
It stayed there for seven days.

original: 大眾唯見光明不見盆樹。
analyzed: 大眾唯見光明不見盆樹。
translated: The assembly only saw the light and did not see the tree in the basin.

original: 王即從座而下供養菩提樹。
analyzed: 王即從座而下供養菩提樹。
translated: The king then descended from his seat and made offerings to the bodhi tree.
After seven days, the tree emitted light again.
It illuminated the Sahā world up to the Brahma Heaven.
The light was retracted and the sky became clear again.

original: 布葉結實從虛空下還入金瓫。
analyzed: 布葉結實從虛空下還入金瓫。
translated: The leaves spread and the fruit formed, falling from the sky and returning to the golden basin.

original: 王見歡喜復更以閻浮利地供養小菩提樹滿於七日。
analyzed: 王見歡喜復更以閻浮利地供養小菩提樹滿於七日。
translated: The king was delighted and again offered the land of Jambudvīpa to the small Bodhi tree for seven days.

original: 王拜菩提樹七日為閻浮利地王。
analyzed: 王拜菩提樹七日為閻浮利地王。
translated: The king bowed to the Bodhi tree for seven days as the king of Jambudvīpa.
On the fifteenth day of the ninth month, the assembly of monks held the poṣadha ceremony.
The Bodhi tree came from its original place.
It arrived at the city of Pāṭaliputra in the east.
It stayed under a śāla tree with luxuriant branches and leaves.
The king was delighted upon seeing it.
He again bowed to it as the king of Jambudvīpa.
He said to Saṃghabhadra,
It is time to leave.
She replied,
Excellent.
Great King.

original: 即與八部鬼神護菩提樹。
analyzed: 即與八部鬼神護菩提樹。
translated: She then went with the eight kinds of ghosts and spirits to protect the Bodhi tree.
The eight kinds of ministers,
the eight kinds of brahmins,

analyzed: 八種居士。 八具波伽人。
translated: the eight kinds of householders,🔽the eight kinds of people from the Gupa region,
the eight kinds of people from the Luchu region,
and the eight kinds of people from the Kāliṅga region.

original: 王與八金甕八銀瓮輦水灌菩提樹。
analyzed: 王與八金甕八銀瓮輦水灌菩提樹。
translated: The king brought eight golden jars and eight silver jars to carry water to water the Bodhi tree.
Having received the king's instructions, they acted accordingly.

original: 王與大眾繞菩提樹送於路上。
analyzed: 王與大眾繞菩提樹送於路上。
translated: The king and the great assembly circumambulated the Bodhi tree and saw it off on the road.

original: 天人夜叉乾闥婆阿修羅日夜供養。
analyzed: 天人夜叉乾闥婆阿修羅日夜供養。
translated: Devas, humans, yakshas, gandharvas, and asuras made offerings day and night.
They arrived at Tamalapattra.
The kings themselves carried the Bodhi tree.
They entered the water up to their necks.
Then they boarded the boat with Sanghamitta.
The king called Tamalapattra and Tamalapattra.
The Bodhi tree is in my country.
I have become the king of Jambudvipa by bowing three times.

original: 我自戴菩提樹入水至頸。
analyzed: 我自戴菩提樹入水至頸。
translated: I myself carried the Bodhi tree into the water up to my neck.
I saw it off and placed it on the boat.
I order Tamalapattra.
The Bodhi tree will go to your country.
You should tell your king.
He should himself go down into the water.
The water will reach his neck.
He should welcome the Bodhi tree and carry it on his head.
As I have made various offerings here.
After giving this order, the boat set off.

original: 是時海中當船住處縱廣一由旬無有波浪。
analyzed: 是時海中當船住處縱廣一由旬無有波浪。
translated: At that time, in the middle of the ocean, where the boat stayed, it was one yojana wide and deep, without any waves.
The king thought to himself.
The Buddha's Bodhi tree is now leaving my country.
Thinking this, he shed tears and choked with grief.

original: 船去之後王遙望見。🔽種種華從海水出隨從船後以供養之。
analyzed: 船去之後王遙望見。 種種華從海水出隨從船後以供養之。
translated: After the boat left, the king watched from afar.🔽Various flowers emerged from the sea and followed behind the boat as offerings.

original: 又虛空中散種種華妓樂供養。
analyzed: 又虛空中散種種華妓樂供養。
translated: In the sky, various flowers were scattered and musical instruments were played as offerings.

original: 水神又以種種華香供養。
analyzed: 水神又以種種華香供養。
translated: The water spirit also made offerings with various flowers and incense.
In this way, [the boat] gradually reached the Dragon King's palace.

original: 龍王即出欲奪取菩提樹。
analyzed: 龍王即出欲奪取菩提樹。
translated: The Dragon King then came out and wanted to seize the Bodhi tree.
Then the bhikṣuṇī Saṃghamitrā
transformed into the king of garuḍas.
The Dragon King bowed and said,

original: 今我欲請菩提樹及大德。
analyzed: 今我欲請菩提樹及大德。
translated: Now I wish to invite the Bodhi tree and the Venerable One
back to my palace for seven days of offerings.

original: 於是菩提樹及大眾悉入龍宮。
analyzed: 於是菩提樹及大眾悉入龍宮。
translated: Then the Bodhi tree and the assembly all entered the Dragon Palace.

original: 龍王以王位拜樹為王七日供養。
analyzed: 龍王以王位拜樹為王七日供養。
translated: The Dragon King offered the throne to the tree as king for seven days of offerings.
After seven days,

original: 龍王自送菩提樹到閻浮俱那衛渚。
analyzed: 龍王自送菩提樹到閻浮俱那衛渚。
translated: the Dragon King personally escorted the Bodhi tree to the Jambūnada River island.

original: 阿育王遙望不復見菩提樹。
analyzed: 阿育王遙望不復見菩提樹。
translated: King Aśoka looked into the distance and could no longer see the Bodhi tree.
He wept and returned.
At that time, King Aśoka

original: 平治道路從城到俱那渚。
analyzed: 平治道路從城到俱那渚。
translated: paved the road from the city to Kunālajīva.
The ground was as flat as a palm.
Saṃghamitrā used her spiritual powers.

original: 令王於宮城內遙見菩提樹來。
analyzed: 令王於宮城內遙見菩提樹來。
translated: She caused the king to see the Bodhi tree coming from within the palace.
The king went out of the island to welcome it to Jambudvīpa.
Kunālajīva entered the water up to his neck.
The tree emitted six-colored light.
The king was delighted upon seeing it.
He held it on his head and brought it to the shore.
There were sixteen great clans of elders in the country.
They welcomed the Bodhi tree together with the king.
When the tree reached the shore,

original: 三日以師子洲供養菩提樹。
analyzed: 三日以師子洲供養菩提樹。
translated: for three days, they made offerings to the Bodhi tree with the provisions of Siṃhala Island.
The sixteen great clans took care of the king's affairs in the country.
After three days, on the fourth day,

original: 擔菩提樹次第到阿㝹羅陀國。
analyzed: 擔菩提樹次第到阿㝹羅陀國。
translated: they carried the Bodhi tree in turn to the country of Anavatapta.

original: 舉國人民歡喜禮拜供養。

original: 諸方人眾皆持供具來詣拘睒彌國。
analyzed: 諸方人眾皆持供具來詣拘睒彌國。
translated: The people from all directions will bring offerings and come to the country of Kośala,
making offerings to the assembly of monks.
At that time, the bhikṣus will not diligently engage in the three activities,
but will spend their days in idle talk.

original: 貪著利養好自嚴飾身著妙服離出家法形類比丘。
analyzed: 貪著利養好自嚴飾身著妙服離出家法形類比丘。
translated: They will be greedy for offerings, will adorn themselves well, will wear fine clothes, will depart from the practices of renunciants, and will resemble bhikṣus in appearance.
But they will be great thieves within the Dharma,
destroying the banner of the true Dharma,
raising the banner of evil māras,
extinguishing the torch of the true Dharma,
kindling the fire of afflictions,

analyzed: 消正法海。 壞正法橋。
translated: drying up the ocean of the true Dharma,🔽destroying the bridge of the true Dharma,
sinking the ship of the true Dharma,
and felling the tree of the true Dharma.

original: 時天龍鬼神等於諸比丘皆生惡意。
analyzed: 時天龍鬼神等於諸比丘皆生惡意。
translated: At that time, the devas, nāgas, and spirits will all give rise to evil intentions towards the bhikṣus,
will detest them and keep their distance,
and will no longer protect them.
They will all cry out in unison, saying:
After seven days, the Buddha's teachings will be completely extinguished.
They wailed and wept.
They said to each other:
On the day of the precepts, the monks will quarrel.
The Tathāgata's true Dharma will perish here.
The upāsakas heard the words of the devas.

original: 共詣眾中諫諸比丘鬪諍。
analyzed: 共詣眾中諫諸比丘鬪諍。
translated: They went together to the assembly and admonished the quarreling monks.
On the fifteenth day, the precepts were to be recited.

original: 時揵陀摩羅山阿羅漢修羅陀。
analyzed: 時揵陀摩羅山阿羅漢修羅陀。
translated: At that time, on Mount Gandhamādana, the arhat Surata

analyzed: 觀閻浮提。 今日何處。
translated: Contemplated Jambudvīpa.🔽Today, where
Is there an assembly of monks who wish to go and recite the precepts?
He then went to Kośala.
At that time, the assembly of monks numbered in the hundreds of thousands.

original: 唯有此阿羅漢修羅陀來。
analyzed: 唯有此阿羅漢修羅陀來。
translated: There was only this arhat Surata who came.

original: 又復有一三藏名曰弟子。
analyzed: 又復有一三藏名曰弟子。
translated: There was also a tripiṭaka master named disciple.

original: 此是如來最後大眾聚集。
analyzed: 此是如來最後大眾聚集。
translated: This was the last great gathering of the Tathāgata's assembly.
At that time, the vihārasvāmin distributed the counting sticks.
He said to the tripiṭaka master:
The assembly of monks has already gathered.
Now, we will recite the Prātimokṣa.
The elder replied,

original: 閻浮提如來弟子皆來集此數有百千。
analyzed: 閻浮提如來弟子皆來集此數有百千。
translated: The disciples of the Tathāgata from Jambudvīpa have all gathered here, numbering in the hundreds of thousands.
Among this assembly, I am the foremost.
I have thoroughly understood the Tripiṭaka but do not study the Vinaya.
How much less so would the others study it?
Now for whom should I expound the Vinaya?

original: 時阿羅漢修羅陀立上座前。
analyzed: 時阿羅漢修羅陀立上座前。
translated: At that time, the arhat Śroṇakoṭiviṃśa stood before the elder
and, with palms joined, said to the elder,
Simply recite the Prātimokṣa.
As when the Buddha was present,

original: 舍利弗目揵連等大比丘眾所學法我今已悉學。
analyzed: 舍利弗目揵連等大比丘眾所學法我今已悉學。
translated: the great bhikṣu assembly, including Śāriputra, Maudgalyāyana, and others, studied the Dharma. I have now studied it all.
Although the Tathāgata has passed away for a thousand years,
I have fully mastered the Vinaya he established.

original: 上座弟子聞修羅陀比丘自言如來所制戒律我悉備持。
analyzed: 上座弟子聞修羅陀比丘自言如來所制戒律我悉備持。
translated: The disciples of the elder heard the bhikṣu Śroṇakoṭiviṃśa say, I have fully mastered the Vinaya established by the Tathāgata,
and gave rise to an intolerant mind.
There was a disciple named Aṅgada
who became extremely angry.
He got up from his seat and reviled that sage.

original: 汝是下座比丘愚癡無智而毀辱我師。
analyzed: 汝是下座比丘愚癡無智而毀辱我師。
translated: You are a junior monk, foolish and ignorant, yet you insult my teacher.
He then took a sharp knife and killed the sage.

original: 時有一鬼名曰大提木法。
analyzed: 時有一鬼名曰大提木法。
translated: At that time, there was a ghost named Da Timu Fa.
He thought like this:
In the world, there is only this one arhat.
Yet he was killed by the evil monk's disciple.
He held a vajra scepter and struck his head, ending his life.
At that time, the disciple of the arhat
saw that his teacher was killed and became angry and could not bear it.
He then killed the tripiṭaka master.
At that time, the devas and people of the world wept sadly,
saying, Alas, it is painful!
The Tathāgata's true Dharma is now completely extinguished.
The great earth shook in six ways.
Immeasurable beings wailed and wept.
They each scattered and left.
At that time, the king of Kośala

original: 聞諸比丘殺阿羅漢及三藏法師。
analyzed: 聞諸比丘殺阿羅漢及三藏法師。
translated: heard that the monks had killed the arhat and the tripiṭaka master.
His heart was filled with distress.
The various heretics vied to destroy the stūpas and temples
and harm the monks.

original: 從是佛法索然頓滅出雜阿含佛告阿難。
analyzed: 從是佛法索然頓滅出雜阿含佛告阿難。
translated: From this, the Buddha's teachings suddenly and completely disappeared. From the Saṃyuktâgama The Buddha told Ānanda:
After my nirvāṇa,
when the Dharma is about to perish,
in the age of the five turbidities, the path of Māra will flourish.
The māra bhikṣus will destroy my path.

original: 著俗衣裳飾好袈裟五色之服。
analyzed: 著俗衣裳飾好袈裟五色之服。
translated: They will wear secular clothing and adorn the kāṣāya with five colors.
They will drink alcohol, roast meat, kill living beings, and crave flavors.
They will have no compassionate mind and will hate each other.
At that time, there will be bodhisattvas who diligently cultivate virtue.
Everyone will respect and revere them.
They will teach and transform equally,
pitying the poor and thinking of the old.
They will rescue and care for the destitute and unfortunate.
They will always use sūtras and images,
causing people to revere and serve them.
They will create various kinds of merit and virtue.
Their disposition will be gentle and kind,
not harming others.
They will give up their bodies to save others,
not sparing themselves.
They will be patient and benevolent.
If there are such people,
the multitude of māra bhikṣus will all be jealous of them.

original: 誹謗揚惡擯黜驅遣不令得住。
analyzed: 誹謗揚惡擯黜驅遣不令得住。
translated: They will slander and expose their faults, expelling and driving them away, not allowing them to stay.
From then on, they did not cultivate morality and virtue.
The temples became deserted and were no longer repaired.
They gradually fell into disrepair.
They were only greedy for wealth and property.
They hoarded and did not disperse.
They did not perform meritorious deeds.
They engaged in buying and selling slaves, and cultivated fields and planted crops.
They burned mountains and forests, harming sentient beings.

analyzed: 無有慈心。 奴為比丘。
translated: They had no compassionate heart.🔽The slaves became monks.
The maids became nuns.
They had no morality and virtue.
They were licentious and confused.
There was no distinction between men and women.
They caused the Way to become weak and diluted.
All of this was due to these people.
Some avoided the county officials.
They relied on my Way.
They sought to become monks.
They did not cultivate the precepts and rules.
Every half month or month,
They were called to lecture on the precepts.
They were tired and lazy.
They did not want to listen.
They abbreviated the beginning and end.
They were unwilling to explain in full.
They did not recite the sutras.
Even if there were reciters,
They did not recognize the characters and phrases.
Is it to speak strongly without consulting the wise?
Arrogant and seeking fame, exhaling like heaven and pushing forward,
Considering it glorious and noble, hoping for others' offerings.
After the demonic bhikṣus end their lives,
Their spirits will fall into the Wuzé Hell.

original: 五逆罪中餓鬼畜生靡不更歷。
analyzed: 五逆罪中餓鬼畜生靡不更歷。
translated: Among the five heinous crimes, they will experience the realms of hungry ghosts and animals.
After passing eons as numerous as the sands of the Ganges, their crimes will be exhausted.

original: 乃出生在邊國無三寶處。
analyzed: 乃出生在邊國無三寶處。
translated: They will then be reborn in border countries without the Three Jewels.
When the Dharma is about to perish,
Women will always diligently make merit.
Men will be lazy and not use the Dharma's words.
Seeing śramaṇas with their eyes is like looking at filth and dirt.
They will have no faith.
The Dharma wheel will be destroyed and the gods will weep.
Water and drought will be out of balance and the five grains will not ripen.
Plagues will spread and many will die.
The people will suffer and county officials will encroach.
Not cultivating the right way, they all think of chaos and disorder.
Evil people will increase and the virtuous will be very few.
The days and months will shorten and people's lives will become shorter.
At forty, his head turned white, and he passed away at the age of sixty.
Men have short lifespans.
Women have long lifespans.
At seventy, eighty, ninety, or even a hundred years old.
A great flood suddenly arises, arriving without warning.
People in the world do not believe it, so they say there is permanence.
Sentient beings of various kinds have no distinction between noble and humble.
Drowning, floating,

original: 漂魚鼈噉食菩薩比丘眾魔驅逐不預眾會。
analyzed: 漂魚鼈噉食菩薩比丘眾魔驅逐不預眾會。
translated: Drifting, fish and turtles devouring each other. The Bodhisattva and the assembly of bhikṣus are driven away by Māra, not participating in the assembly.

original: 菩薩入山福德之處惔怕自守以為忻快。
analyzed: 菩薩入山福德之處惔怕自守以為忻快。
translated: The Bodhisattva enters the mountain, a place of blessings and virtues, tranquil and self-controlled, taking it as joyful.
His lifespan is prolonged, and he is guarded by the devas.
When the moon-like one appears in the world, they meet each other.

original: 共興吾道五十二歲。🔽首楞嚴經。
analyzed: 共興吾道五十二歲。 首楞嚴經。
translated: Together they promote our Way for fifty-two years.🔽The Śūraṃgama-sūtra.
The Pratyutpanna Samādhi Sūtra.
First disappearing and transforming away.

original: 十二部經尋復化滅盡不復現不見文字。
analyzed: 十二部經尋復化滅盡不復現不見文字。
translated: The twelve divisions of the canon will then transform and disappear, no longer appearing or seen in written form.
The saṃgha's kāṣāya robes will naturally turn white.
After the sage king leaves, my Dharma will be completely extinguished.

original: 譬如油燈臨欲滅時光更猛盛。
analyzed: 譬如油燈臨欲滅時光更猛盛。
translated: It is like an oil lamp about to go out, its light becomes even brighter.
Then it goes out.
When my Dharma is about to end, it will also be like a lamp going out.
After this, it will be difficult to maintain discipline.

original: 如是久後彌勒當下世間作佛。
analyzed: 如是久後彌勒當下世間作佛。
translated: In this way, after a long time, Maitreya will descend to the world and become a Buddha.
The world will be at peace, and poisonous qi will be eliminated.
Rain will be moist and harmonious, and the five grains will flourish.
Trees will grow tall, and people will grow eight zhang tall.
They will all live for 84,000 years.
The number of sentient beings who will attain liberation is incalculable.
From the Sutra on the Extinction of the Dharma
